title: Getting permanently banned does really f*ck you over quite hard...
body:
I'm not here to cry. I'm just here to ask if it's really hard for Riot to implement a feature where you can login to your account and atleast access your profile without touching a queue or game. That way, I can recover all my friends on my smurf and make sure I am still in contact with them. 

Atleast give me some type of social communication god damn it.

replies.body:
No.

The point is that you are not allowed to have a smurf and it will also be permbanned without any further reason if discovered.

 What part of _permanent_ do you not get?

? You're just pulling his leg, right? Having one account banned does not affect any other or ban you from creating more. The only time you aren't allowed to create an account is if they specifically ban you as a player, which is *very* rare (see Tyler1, Jensen).

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=N4A1xH3f,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-02-06T00:15:13.388+0000)
>
> ? You're just pulling his leg, right? Having one account banned does not affect any other or ban you from creating more. The only time you aren't allowed to create an account is if they specifically ban you as a player, which is *very* rare (see Tyler1, Jensen).

Right but they don't really want you to make a new one and add the same friends as you had before and start being toxic again.... assuming toxicity is a social norm, surround yourself with better people?

While I don't really know their exact reasons for withholding that information, I don't think "We don't want you to add those people on a new account" is one of them.

It does make sense to want you to separate yourself from negative influences, but trying to enforce that really doesn't seem like a logical move from a video game company; that's something your parents do at home.

Who said I was banned for toxicity?

You all make your assumptions based on information I have given out, and none of the information I have given shows that I was banned for toxicity.

Furthermore, I only want access to my FR list because I know some really good people there who I wish to keep contact with.

Because toxicity is the only thing anyone gets banned for, aside from scripting and chargeback abuse, which are very rare.

Your attitude kind of speaks for itself, anyway..

No, that is just your assumption. I was not banned for toxicity, I was banned for using a skin ID changer.
And judging someone's attitude through a paragraph of text? Please...
I was responding to Anti Teemo about what he said only. I'm sorry if there was confusion causing you to think I was speaking of your case.

I think there was a possibility to log into the mobile lol app that gives you the ability to chat with your friends from league and it did not check if you were permabanned , you can try this :) 


tell me if it worked if you try tho
I'm not sure it would work, but if there's a way to do this then the mobile app would be it.
im 99% sure it worked ( it was on reddit that guy logged on mobile app as a permabanned account ) dunno if they changed it tho

While I don't think this is something Riot actively prevents, it's also not something they're going to put much money or effort into. I would try a support ticket to see if they can just give you a printout of the names on your friends list and let it go if they say they can't do that.
I actually asked Keyru about this the other day and was informed that player support cannot do this.
You've got a point, but the whole idea of writing and developing code so someone who broke the rules can recover his friends seems laughable at best.
I think that it's just something to consider when deciding how to behave.
